snippet: Tania Bruguera, a Cuban artist based in New York who was arrested in December in Havana, said Wednesday that she had not been able to find a lawyer willing to defend her.
abstract: Cuban artist Tania Bruguera, who is based in New York and was arrested in Havana, where she was planning a political open-mic event, says she has had difficulty finding lawyer willing to represent her; prosecutors have 60 days to decide whether to charge her with inciting public unrest.
lead_paragraph: Tania Bruguera, a Cuban artist based in New York who was arrested in December in Havana, said Wednesday that she had not been able to find a lawyer willing to defend her.

headline.main: Cuba: Artist Awaits Decision on Charges
headline.print_headline: Cuba: Artist Awaits Decision on Charges
